critique: The document is an executive order focused on increasing electricity access in Sub-Saharan Africa through the Power Africa initiative. It aims to double access to power by adding 30,000 MW of capacity and 60 million new connections by 2030, emphasizing cleaner energy sources and inclusive economic growth. The order establishes a working group to coordinate efforts among various government agencies and encourages partnerships with African governments, the private sector, and civil society. It also directs agencies to facilitate the participation of local and regional companies in renewable energy projects. The initiative aligns with the Electrify Africa Act of 2015 and seeks to reduce poverty and drive economic growth through sustainable power solutions.
